snippet: Italy said Friday that Britain had not informed them of attempt to rescue a Briton and an Italian held hostage by an Islamist militant group in Nigeria. Both men were found dead.
abstract: Italy criticizes Britain for not consulting them in raid of Islamist militant compound in Nigeria that ended with deaths of British hostage Christopher McManus and Italian hostage Franco Lamolinara.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and JOHN F. BURNS
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Rome, and John F. Burns from London.

lead_paragraph: Italy said Friday that Britain had not informed them of attempt to rescue a Briton and an Italian held hostage by an Islamist militant group in Nigeria. Both men were found dead.

headline.seo: Failed Rescue of Hostages in Nigeria Angers Italy
headline.main: Failed Raid to Rescue Hostages in Nigeria Stirs Italy’s Anger
headline.print_headline: Failed Raid to Rescue Hostages in Nigeria Stirs Italy’s Anger
